Text: It doesn't seem to be in XviD, Quick time nor VLC can't play that file. Which codec should I use
Did anyone ever figure out how to get it to work?  I'm googling the UDHF format and its not looking so good.  Some say its a fake/corrupted format, others are unclear as to what it is.

Update: UDHF, from which this was encoded, is initiated by 'VoxWare MetaSound' codec.  I won't know if it works until I get this [slow] download to my computer.  But in case I do not remember to update, the codec can be found here:

http://www.free-codecs.com/download/VoxWare_MetaSound_Audio_CoDec.htm

c'mon folks, DiVX/XviD is supported and loved by everyone- use it!
The codec has failed to work on a couple of media players.  Now unless the 8 other seeders can give an idea of how to access it, or the "Anonymous", I'd suggest not even to download it.
So I figure that either 1) No one has figured out how to correctly play this codec or 2) Those that have and are seeding do know how, but never read or respond to the comments.
I've completed the download and trying somethings. If I'll be success to play, I'll write here how I did.
